Where did all my files go?

data.title: Crash on loading large SQL file
data.body: I tried to load a large SQL document (~176 MB). It first showed the information that the editor could become unresponsive. I clicked okay. Than showed a window that the editor IS unresponsive after a couple of minutes later. I clicked okay. After a short time, the editor crashed.

data.title: Hijacking keyboard and mouse?
data.body:
:wave: Hi folks,

I'm going to have to say sorry in advance for what is going to be a very vague bug report. I'll do everything I can to help you dig up the details you need though

After I updated to 1.0 :tada: I noticed that on occasion my machine would stop being responsive to the keyboard and mouse - sort of. Making mouse movements seemed delayed, text input basically stopped working. While this was occurring, it was very difficult for me to even open activity monitor to check which app was causing the problem. Atom was one of the few apps open in the doc, I managed to force quit the app and every suddenly returned to normal.

Tonight it happened again, only worse. Atom seemed to be on auto pilot, deleting line by line what I was working on. My mouse and keyboard would take no input. The only way I could record what was happening was with my ipad - [here is my shaky recording](https://www.dropbox.com/s/2texc0ral95t84p/atom%20bug.mov?dl=0). I had to hard reset my machine. 

Let me know what other information I can get which will make this easier to pin point.

data.title: resize pane not work when atom running under guest OS under virtualbox with mouse intergration on
data.body:
Host OS: WIndows 7
Guest OS: Ubuntu LInux

WHen running atom under the guest os , the resize icon is not display when the mouse cursor is between two pane. Trying to drag it to resize  does not work. Disable mouse intergration will solve the problem.
Probably due to mouse over event is not send to the editor when mouse integration is on

data.title: Default key shortcuts infers with diacritic symbol typing #win32
data.body:
I am not able to put ż polish diacritic symbol. This is normally achieved by Right_ALT+Z (most common keyboard layout in PL). I used resolver to check what it does and it triggers editor:checkout-head-revision 

Right_ALT+O gives mi application:add-project-folder instead of ó

LEFT_ALT is not used it would be great to use it instead

data.title: Settings tab always visible when starting Atom
data.body:
I'm new to Atom and have just had a quick play, but am confused as to why, having once looked at the Settings, the Settings tab opens every time I open Atom, whether I had previously closed it or not. Is this intended behaviour?

I am running Atom 1.0.0 on Win7 Pro SP1 (64-bit).

Thanks

Dear ATOM developers:

Considering some users are living in China, which have a restricted networking, the ATOM app's download server is on Amazon at present, we really hard to get the APP in here, can we put a copy on http://sourceforge.net/

Thank you!
Ken.

data.title: Redo not working bug?
data.body:
I cannot seem to replicate the bug I encountered, But I figure it's probably worth checking for an issue.
After writing some 50 lines of CSS, and then using CMD+Z to undo about 30 of those lines and saving, I was unable to CMD+Y to Redo that code I removed. I was luckily able to get it back through via the dev tools. Haven't been able to replicate the issue, but for now I'm going to switch back to my previous editor to be safe.

Using the new Version 1.0, with only 3 extra plugins: Autoprefixer, Atom-terminal and emmet.

data.title: Cannot install shell commands if no window is open
data.body:
Atom 1.0.0
Mac OS X 10.10.3

_Description_

If there are no windows open, the menu command **Atom > Install Shell Commands** is not available. This command should always be available.

_Step to Reproduce_
1. Launch Atom
2. Close all windows
3. From menu bar, choose **Atom > Install Shell Commands**

_Expected Behavior_

The command should be available (black text).

_Observed Behavior_

The command is not available (gray text).

data.title: Opening settings view rewrites newline values in config.cson
data.body:
**General issue:**
I have a few key:value pairs in my config.cson file that have "\n" as the value. If I open Atom's settings view, those values get immediately overwritten with triple quotes surrounding blank lines of indentation.

So for example:

```
    "space-after-opening-brace": "\n"
```

becomes

```
    "space-after-opening-brace": '''


    '''
```

The issue is recreatable in safe mode, and no errors appear in the dev tools.

**Specific details:**
If I leave Atom open and edit the config file back to the correct "\n" values, I can toggle back and forth to settings and it will stay correct. However, if I change any settings or enable/disable a package, the config file is overwritten again.

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6453842/8423840/cfdd90fe-1ebd-11e5-8f4e-3e3e2edbe55e.gif)

Atom v1.0.0 on OS X 10.9.5

data.title: "Save" or "Save All" on unmodified, opened files results in "Unable to save file: permission denied" error
data.body: When working with a project under Perforce revision control, it is normal for unmodified files to be read-only on the file system.  Currently, I get several errors when I do "Save All" when I have several unmodified files open.  It would be nice to not get the error when the files are unmodified.  There are cases where there be several opened files, some modified and some not.  "Save all" would only have to save the modified files.  Of course, if the modified files are still read-only, it makes sense to report the "Unable to save file" error.

data.title: Open recent?
data.body: Would be nice to be able to open recent projects or window configurations instead of having to digging and adding a dir to a window every time I decide to close it and re open it later.

data.title: Performance after 1.0 release on OS X 10.10.3
data.body:
Since I installed the 1.0 release of Atom the performance has been absolutely atrocious.  I don't mean "a bit slower than before" but tremendous slow-down/lag when typing, accessing menus, etc.  I tried re-installing Atom (yes, I cleaned out my .atom directory) but it did not fix the issue.

Has anyone else experienced similar problems?

data.title: Consider tabs or spaces mutually exclusively as indentation
data.body:
Closes #5658 
Closes #5642

A huge huge thanks to @driskell for identifying the issue and taking action to fix it. I used a slightly adapted version of his test case in this PR, but took a different approach to solving the problem.

Previously, we allowed a mix of tabs and spaces to be counted toward the indentation of a line. This caused problems when auto-indenting lines in a hard-tabbed file that contained “alignment spaces”, such as occurs in aligned comment blocks. For this case, it makes more sense to assume that the line is indented via tabs only, and consider the subsequent alignment space as part of the line’s content. This means it's actually more correct to only consider tabs **or** spaces, but not both when reading or updating a line's indentation.

data.title: Clarify that config files require unique keys
data.body:
From https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7552#issuecomment-116735581

A lot of people try to use the config files as they would a stylesheet, trying to override keybindings for instance by repeating the same selector multiple times in the file, which causes issues because CSON keys must be unique. This makes it a bit more explicit that keys need to be unique.

data.body: Hello, I followed your instructions on how to build on linux but they aren't working for me. If I run command 'atom' i get this error: nohup: failed to run command `/tmp/atom-build/Atom/atom': No such file or directory Help

data.title: Remove deferred browser process requires
data.body:
This is a temporary fix for #6548 until #6877 is merged.

Basically just do the requires up front instead of deferred so this asar bug isn't hit.

This should have an incredibly minimal negative impact to startup time since these deferred requires are incredibly small and asar is now used so it is only two extra file reads at startup.

Closes #6548

data.title: List item height should not be based on @component-line-height
Reintroduce assertion API
data.body: This was briefly introduced in #7350, but reverted before we went 1.0 to minimize risk. It's the logical next step in attacking our uncaught exceptions.
